Posts.Content: I had my last chemo 9 June 2011 (FEC-T) and have nearly finished the radiotherapy. My hair is trying to come back but my fingernails have started to lift off! Painless but I didn't expect it. I take it this must have happened to others? Did you lose them all? At the mo I have 3 'lifting' and assume it's the chemo. Thanks
Posts.Title: losing fingernails!

Posts.Content: Thanks for all messages - I'm glad it's not just me! I now have 7 fingernails lifting. I haven't spoken to the BC nurse but I ike the idea of soaking in tea-tree oil as the pharmacist said to be mindful about infection. My nails are lifting from about half way down the nail at the mo - yuk. Still, they'll grow out eventually! Good luck all. Thanks Nat

Posts.Title: node removal and cording

Posts.Content: Hi. I had a double mastectomy just over two weeks ago. Had the dressings removed two days ago and the doctor said the discomfort in one arm is 'cording' as I had all the nodes removed. Has anyone else experienced this? How long did it take to go away? I can't straighten my arm high and it's very uncomfortable. Will it get better? Thank you.
Posts.Title: node removal and cording

Posts.Content: Hi This sounds terrible for you. Did they do the mastectomy but leave the reconstruction? Or none of it? It sounds to me like they're not sure either and perhaps have to have one of their meetings to discuss your situation with the whole team involved with your treatment plan but of course that doesn't help you in the interim. What about asking your brease care nurse to help you get answers? Or your GP? Wish I could do something. Good luck. x
Posts.Title: Answers to questions, why cant tey tell us?

Posts.Content: hi again. I too had a double mastectomy but I knew they weren't going to reconstruct at the same time. I have to have chemo and rt before they want to look at any reconstruction work.....but at least I knew what was happening. Have you had any more info? You should definitely not be left to deal with this alone and quietly. I hope the great macmillan nurse you have found helps you more. ndp xx
